blip.translation[0].definitions[0].defin: a short high electronic sound, or a flashing light on the screen of a piece of electronic equipment
blip.translation[0].definitions[1].defin: a short pause or change in a process or activity, especially when the situation gets worse for a while before it improves again
blip.translation[0].definitions[1].examp: A government spokesman described the rise in inflation as a temporary blip.
blip.translation[1].definitions[0].defin: a change in which a situation gets worse for a short time, and then usually gets better again soon afterwards
blip.translation[1].definitions[0].examp: These are definitely not short-term investments and not for anyone who panics every time there is a blip in the stock market.
